instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vp0r, ppbus 8.44v
threads.message:
Hi.

Liquid damaged board.
Did not power
Repaired corrosion around <TRANSISTOR>Q8510</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
Now powers.

ASD reports VP0R below low limit.

Charger plugged PPBUS is 8.44V

I unplugged the charger and ran ASD again and it's not reporting error but  PPBUS is 7.7V

What's going on here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vp0r, ppbus 8.44v
threads.message: Is this machine recognizing and charging the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vp0r, ppbus 8.44v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 10971"]Is this machine recognizing and charging the battery?
[/QUOTE]

Yeah it knows the charger is there and it runs off the battery.
Stays powered with PPBUS at 7.7V which I have tested with 3 different meters. It's running fine but I really don't like to send it out like this.
I did not think it could even turn on at this voltage but it does.... I can take a picture!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vp0r, ppbus 8.44v
threads.message: You didn't answer my question. With PPBUS at 8.4 I bet the data bus from SMC is not ok. So again, does it recognize the battery in OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vp0r, ppbus 8.44v
threads.message:
Yes, in OS X
it knows the battery is there
it knows the charger is there
it charges the battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vp0r, ppbus 8.44v
